attributes.additional_details:
More and more people are finding a link between air fresheners and perfume and asthma-type symptoms.

Depending on what is in it they can affect the nervous system, heart rhythm, endocrine system and ear nose and throat with a potential to anaphylaxis.

If somewhere is clean they are not necessary and the NHS could save a lot of money taken up treating people that have been unavoidably affected.  We've had smoking in public enclosed places banned, why not this as I believe it is toxic to  an increasing number of adults and children, the main people benefitting are those with investments in pharmaceutical industries.
